captions.text:
Minecraft actually began in the form of
another game titled RubyDung

not much is known about the game
other than that it was influenced by a

city-building freeware game called Dwarf
Fortress
while Notch was working on RubyDung he found another game titled Infiniminer

Infiniminer was an open source
multiplayer block-based sandbox
building and digging game

sharing many similar features with what
would later become Minecraft

the name Minecraft came about when a user
in an IRC chatroom with notch
suggested itbut originally Notch wanted to call it Minecraft: Order of the Stone

this is the first ever version and released
video of the game

then only titled as Cave Game only four
days later on May 17th 2009

the very first alpha version of the game
is released to the public

this image is believed to be the first
ever in game creation shared by a user
only 49 minutes after the game was released

and two and a half hours after release
the very first in-game sprite art in the

form of an 8-bit Mario was created and
shared

if you're even slightly involved in the
Minecraft gaming community it's very likely
you've heard about Herobrine

it's a creepypasta story about the
character in the game which looks
exactly like the protagonist Steve

with the exception of the eyes which are
completely white

different sources state that Herobrine either
started on 4chan or the minecraft forums

sometimes in mid to late 2010 since then
it's achieved an enormous popularity

with a large following creating various
mods texture packs skins another game
content to bring Herobrine to life

it got so popular that even the game's
creators and developers started making
little hints and easter eggs towards it

for example in several patch updates
they've added a line "Herobrine Removed"

or in the Xbox 360 version of the game
there's a loading screen note that reads
"We think 4J Studios has removed Herobrine, but we're not too sure"
however like almost every other creepypasta story

it's all a work of fiction there's
nothing in the source code of the game
to indicate Herobrine's existence

and Notch has officially said himself that
Herobrine is not

in the game and that there are no plans
for a future implementation

the creeper is a very iconic creature in
Minecraft

but it was actually created by mistake the
creeper came about when the length and

height of a pig model was accidentally
inverted resulting in a tall midsection
with small legs

Notch liked the look of the model and added a
green texture to it

and so the creeper was born all the
creatures in the game

are genderless even the main
protagonists Steve is neither male or female

or both the name Steve was actually just
suggested as a joke by Notch

but the name stuck with players and has
been widely used ever since

if you want to be accurate Steve should
be referred to only as
The Player
Minecraft is pretty huge I mean like really huge

it's so huge that you could say it's
infinite and no one would be the wiser
however that is technically not true

the map itself might be infinite but the
part of the map the player can interact
with and walk-on

is not one block in Minecraft equals 1
meter and if you stand in the center of

the world you will have approximately
thirty

million blocks in any given direction
that's sixty million meters in both the
z and x axis
that equals 3.6 quadrillion

square meters seven thousand times
larger than the surface of the earth

beyond this edge world generation is
drastically simplified

you'll fall right through blocks and the
game will most likely crash

there's been some ridiculously amazing
and obviously time-consuming minecraft
creations over the years

here are a few examples the city King's
Landing from the TV series Game of Thrones

a computer inside Minecraft using
redstone

one of the large cities from the Lord of
the Rings universe

Mirrors Edge a scale model of the
Starship from the TV series Battlestar Galactica

an original Minecraft world called
Imperial City

when you create a new Minecraft world
you do not only create 1 world
both 3 the default world or dimension

is called The Overworld then by using
portals you can travel to two other
dimensions

these were in the beginning supposed to
be representations of heaven

and hell however only the latter made it
into the game in the form of

The Nether the third dimension which was
originally going to be called Sky
Dimension turned into a world called
The End the home world of the endermens and if you've played Minecraft you
should know it's anything but heaven

if you open up the texture
for Zombie Pigmen

you'll find a hidden message written on it
the message is a thank you note from

Notch to the original creator of the
skin

and while speaking of textures 3 of the
pictures featured on paintings in the game
are from the game Counter Strike

part of Minecraft's success is believed to
be the cause of the games constant updates

new content is added frequently which
keeps the game alive

but because of the constant updates
there're bound to be ideas that never

made it into the current version of the
game

and sometimes you just have to wonder
why

for example Gears was a block that was
supposed to be added to the game

but for unknown reasons they never did and
most likely was replaced by redstone

it's not know what function Gears would
have had but the files has since been

completely removed from the current
versions of the game

another feature was lanterns just like
torches you could hold the lantern in
your hand but unlike torches

you did not have to place the lantern
ford it to shine

meaning you could walk around at night
with the lantern equipped

and be able to see just fine Emerald ore
was never supposed to be in the game

but was changed from the previous idea
of Ruby ore

at the last stages of implementation
because a developer had trouble
spotting the difference between Ruby ore

and redstone the texture of Ruby ore can
still be found the game files and it's

unknown whether or not they will be
used in the future

also in the texture files of game
there seems to be textures

for a chair and a table leading many
players to believe

furniture was at some point supposed to
be added to the game

but don't worry many of these dropped
or on hold ideas and features can
still be added today by using mods
